description: 共同科英文（二）課程為一學期兩學分課程，係為非英語系學生所開設的課程。目標在幫助大一學生活用中學時期所累積的英語知識，提昇英語聽、說、讀、寫整體的溝通能力。為達此目標，本課程要求教師盡量用英語上課，努力營造一個豐富的英語環境，讓學生不但有充分機會以英語參與課堂活動，且樂於使用英語與同學及老師溝通。
goals: 1. 增進學生英語溝通表達能力 2. 透過參與課程活動促進團隊精神 3. 透過多面向英語閱讀促使學生了解多元文化，拓展學生國際化視野 4. 透過課堂討論培養批判精神 5. 提升學生英語學習動機及自主學習興趣
syllabus:
Freshman English Spring 2019

Syllabus

Instructor: Chingshun J. Sheu 許景順 ([cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw](mailto:cjsheu@ntnu.edu.tw))

Textbook: _Keynote 4_, from 師大書苑

Objectives: Students will improve their English reading, writing, listening, and speaking skills, as well as foster habits of independent study to continue improving outside the classroom. This semester focuses especially on listening and speaking.

Grading:        10% Speeches and essay

                        20% Group presentation

                        30% Final exam

                        40% Independent study

Students will give two speeches and write one essay. Students may choose to give another speech if time allows, and the two highest grades will be recorded. Students in the audience will be asked to offer constructive criticism.

Group presentation: Each group will present an oral report in English on a process, issue, or phenomenon, with every group member presenting. Presenters should try not to only read the presentation slides. The length must be under 20 minutes.

Independent study: Students must do 5 of the following, OR 3 and one assigned book report, for proportionate credit. Plagiarism will result in an assignment grade of F.

*   8 quizzes on Moodle, one for each lecture week
*   50 entries in a notebook for vocabulary learned inside and outside the classroom; each entry should include an English definition and English example sentence
*   10 visits at the English Self-Learning Classroom (excluding _5 Star Day_, _The Big Bang Theory_, and _Emergency Room_)
*   10 hours at the English Chat Room
*   1 event report: reflections on participating in an event in English
*   1 book report: reflections on reading an English book of suitable difficulty (including _Far from the Tree_ if you do not submit an assigned book report)
*   1 film report: reflections on watching an English film without Chinese subtitles, including at the English Self-Learning Classroom

Assigned book report: Students may read the following book (introduction, one chapter, and conclusion) and answer questions provided by the instructor. Students may propose a different book to read, subject to instructor approval.

*   Andrew Solomon, _Far from the Tree_
